intro: Chaunochiton loranthoides, commonly known as the ghost barnacle, is a unique marine organism that belongs to the family Lepadidae. It is a sessile, filter-feeding barnacle that attaches itself to the surfaces of other marine organisms, such as fish or whales. Its body is encased in a calcareous shell composed of multiple plates, which provide structural support and protection. The plant-like appearance of its shell has led to its common name, though it is not a true plant but a crustacean. This species plays an important role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the biodiversity of epibenthic communities.
